page.title: 15DALRY(KIRK) TRADITIONS
page.content: The New Year is the main family feast and all try to get home for it. As soon as possible after midnight on Hogmanay, Dec. 31st. people 'first foot' friends,sharing a 'dram'and often eating rich fruit cake, black bun, shortbread or mince pies.Each member of the household is embraced and wished 'A Guid New Year' Hallowe'en on October 31st.,is marked by the children 'guising'.The children in fancy dress, visit houses reciting poems or singing litttle songs or even playing a musical instrument in return for a gift of a piece of fruit, sweets,nuts or occasionally, a small coin.
